intro: Serena carnea, commonly known as the pink nightshade, is a flowering plant belonging to the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. The plant has oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and its stems are often covered in fine绒毛. Native to parts of Asia, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. However, it is important to note that all parts of the plant contain toxic compounds and should be handled with care.
